page.title: 06SEA BIRDS IN EDAY
page.content: Along the coasts of Eday there are many sea birds. Probably the most common here is the fulmar or mallimack as the locals call it. They nest along the cliffs by the shore. Also to be found are kittiwakes, gannets, all sorts of gulls, razorbills, arctic terns and guillemots. All of these birds nest by the shore, lay their eggs in late summer and the chicks are ready to leave the nest by late autumn. Most of these birds live on a diet of fish, some catch and eat live fish and some eat the remains or oil from the fish.
